reviewText: Alright, first and foremost lets get the obvious out of the way.  This is a direct rip-off of Paranormal Activity.  They knew this when they made it, and anyone that claims this little fact as a reason for hating the movie should never have watched it in the first place.  Watch this movie because you really enjoyed Paranormal Activity and wouldn't mind watching another inferior version of the same plot to see what they add to it.I really liked Paranormal Activity.  When I saw a movie called Paranormal Entity on Netflix, I knew I had to watch it and just see how bad it really was.  I won't lie, it isn't the greatest....but surprisingly it wasn't the worst either.  I will use spoilers ahead because I truly feel that you have to break a movie like this down in order to truly review it.The acting was quite poor.  It was just very amateur.  For a movie like this, the actors need to be "not actors."  In other words, they need to look like real people going through this stuff, and not like actors playing people going through this stuff.  It wasn't terrible through the whole movie, but definitely got worse when things started getting intense.Pacing was a little too fast in this one.  Things really get going quick.  Some people love that.  I however, prefer to get to know the characters better.The scares were pretty similar to Paranormal Activity.  Lots of crazy invisible things going on, with loud slamming doors and knocks.  Perhaps the best "new" addition to this movie is the demon's motives.  It wants the sister character in more than one way.  That's a freaky concept.  There is also a scene with an alarm system of sorts involving bells that I thought was a decent idea.Honestly there is a lot of bad elements to this movie.  I was able to "trick" myself into just not seeing them.  However, for you over thinkers out there I will admit that they really messed some things up.  The characters continue to sleep in separate rooms and just let the sister suffer each night.  They never have other people over to witness the "happenings."  The psychic that is supposed to help, is conveniently on a very long vacation while these people are getting destroyed.  The sister is obviously attractive, and is scantly clad throughout the movie when she is probably scared out of her mind.  Probably most notable of all, the beginning has the mother character calling 911, the end it's the son.Watch this movie with a grain of salt for lack of a better saying.  You could enjoy it if you can get past it's short-comings, of which there are many.
summary: Good, if you don't over think it.....
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Andrew Thompson "a.k.a. Jake Kincaid, Jack of...
reviewText: I was one of those people that actually enjoyed "Paranormal Activity".Of course, I never believed it was a true story, and never claimed it was a "good" film...in fact, all I said was that I enjoyed the "less is more" feeling, and that it found that place in me where the small child is, and squeezed on that nerve held back in my subconscious 10 year-old mind wondering what the hell those sounds were in the middle of the night.That being said, I think I'm now feeling what all of you out there that DIDN'T like "Paranormal Activity" felt...this movie, besides being an absolutely shameless rip-off, didn't even deliver the goods that "Activity" did.  At least in "Activity", you SAW some scary things...the footprints were otherworldly...the sounds were ungodly...and the camera didn't get pushed into the closet during important scenes...I guess we're supposed to believe that this particular demonic entity KNEW it was being filmed, and decided itself (in approved parental/MPAA fashion) that what it was about to do would be something that didn't need to be committed to posterity.Demons with a conscience...how refreshing.I would like to say something redeeming about this one, but I already pulled out everything good about this movie and said it about the superior "Paranormal Activity"...being this is a cheap and unapologetic copy, I won't even attempt to justify it's values (or lack thereof).OK I guess if you liked "Activity" and have extra cash for the rental...otherwise, a total waste of time...you've seen it, and a better version to boot.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Let me begin by saying that this film is obviously inspired by Paranormal Activity, it have the same set up, a household where strange Paranormal things happen where they inhabitants decides to film the whole thing to see if they can figure out what is going on and the movie then presented in a home video format. I however do not agree that Paranormal Entity is a remake of Paranormal Activity, the story is rather different even if the concept is the same. Asylum is known for making their own versions of popular movies and I sort of think they have lived both up to their reputation as copycats here and at the same time managed to create their own movie with it's own story.Paranormal Entity is about a widowed mother and her two teen children that live in a nice house together. The mother start using automatic writing to communicate with her husband and then strange things starts to happen around the house. Now it is here I start having some problems with the film, it moves to quickly. The things that made Paranormal Activity scary was it's realism, even if you knew you where watching a film you could sort of imagine this being a real home movie, what helped this effect was that the paranormal happenings where suable at first and just gradually became more threatening. Paranormal Entity throws all this slow buildup out the door and you have things flying from the start. Another thing that reduces the effectiveness of the film is the family's house, it is just to neat, it look like a shabby chick dream house from a interior decoration magazine, there is hardy any personal objects just lying around unless they are used as part of the storytelling, all that make it hard to believe that anyone is actually living there. The third problem with this film is the actress that play the sister. Now the sister is supposed to be very traumatized and she do not talk much, but this is drawn out into idiotic degrees with whole scene with just the brother asking his sister questions on everyday thing and she staring at him. Now this could work if she was catatonic but she is not, she go out on the town, have a normal life she is just a brat and refuse to speak or even acknowledge her brother is there most of the time. The actress do this very poorly and the sister just come off as arrogant and spoiled and that do not do when the viewer is supposed to be horrified at what happens to her.Paranormal Entity moves to fast, have bad acting and a to sterile set, but all in all I did enjoy the movie, it not a great movie but if you like haunted house movies then I think you will like this one. The story is okey, some of the effects towards the end is spooky, and if you liked Paranormal Activity then this might help tide you over until the next movie in the franchise. However all in all Paranormal Entity was rather mediocre, it was not bad, but it was not really memorable either.

reviewText: Paranormal Entity is the latest addition to the independent low budget horror movie rip offs. I don't know what movie these other people were watching who wrote great reviews but it wasn't the Paranormal Entity I saw. Paranormal Entity was shot like a video camera documentary and perhaps this is why the horror was muffled.To be fair, its horrible, and it isn't scary either.

reviewText: Twenty-three-year old Thomas Finley was arrested for the murders of his sister, Samantha, and Edgar Lauren, professor and paranormal investigator. Police were called to the scene by Finley himself. He was found with his sister cradled in his arms. Despite the evidence against him, Thomas claimed that the victims were attacked by a demonic entity of unknown origin. Days later, he committed suicide. his video, which was found at the scene, is being released to the public as a record of what really happened inside the Finley home.I'd have to say both movies were about on par with one another as far as scares and whatnot are concerned. It's relevant to point out that both movies were low-budget. The only difference is that Paranormal Activity got more promotion and advertisement. The only thing I found, between the two movies, is that Enitity suffers with several plot holes and script woes. The acting was decent and believable. It was never boring enough, at any time, for me to quit watching. I ended up watching it through to the end.Overall, I enjoyed the movie despite it being labeled as a Paranormal Activity rip-off. It was okay, in my opinion. The only reason why I say that is the fact that 'found footage movies' really aren't my thing anymore. There's too many of them out there now and I've lost interest in these type of movies. For what it's worth, Paranormal Entity is worth a look, if not a purchase. It's not quite that bad. Regardless of what you read here.

reviewText: As is the case with any of the other Asylum releases, PARANORMAL ENTITY is a virtual remake of the smash hit PARANORMAL ACTIVITY, retaining all of the same structure with only minor character and plot changes. Ironically, this cheap cash-in both proves and disproves the effectiveness of the original film. The rapid-fire scares in ENTITY make it far more skeptical than the subtle haunts in ACTIVITY, but the cleverly implied scares that are created in both show that almost anyone can pick up a camera and generate the same level of terror with hardly any effort. Van Dyke asks very little of his actors, and receives little in return besides the expectantly bland performances and the obligatory nude scene. As a matter of budgetary convenience, the cameras placed in the rooms that are experiencing activity just happen to either get pushed aside or knocked over during pivotal moments. This leaves the viewer staring at a blank screen for much of the film. Regardless of the fact that it is nothing more than a clone, there are still enough realistic touches that are further emphasized by the lack of music in order to make PARANORMAL ENTITY a genuinely unnerving watch.-Carl ManesI Like Horror Movies

reviewText: Despite what some of the other reveiwers on here may have thought, and its clear rip on the new horror classic (Paranormal Activity). I didnt think it was that bad. In fact a few years from now it couldve been one of those B-Movie sequels. Paranormal Activity 7, or something like that. Overall, if you were into the original you'd probably enjoy this. The only really big flaw, and probably the reason why so many people complain. Is the horrible ending. It shouldve have been about 15 mins longer. They shouldve shown what happened to the doctor, and how the sister ended up on the floor in the room. As for rip offs. Anytime there is something new in the world of movies & music, its copied. Especially when its made for cheap, and grosses tons of cash like PA.

reviewText: Very derivative work made two years after Paranormal Activity, which is a far better flick, Paranormal Entity is a weak mocumentary about a haunting that arises out a wife's grief. In all fairness (kindness?), making a mockumentary based solely on purported home video would be very difficult. It's hard to develop a plot without using some artifice to introduce exposition. But when all you have is one scene after another of breaking glass, drawing letters on a table, and the covers being dragged off a teenage girl, some artifice, please!The actors do a good job of making credible home movie footage, though the camera used to film them wouldn't be found in any home except, perhaps, Steven Spielberg's. But the plot can be stated in one sentence: There is an entity in the house that is either the dead father or a dark force. You can guess which one it is. Then imagine some scenes like those described above, and that it. For 90 minutes. Sorry, guys, but this has been done, and its not even worth doing.
summary: A poor substitute for Paranormal Activity

reviewText: Everyone can agree that it is a clone of Paranormal Activity but this one DOES NOT rely entirely on loud noises and dropping cookware from the ceiling. Unlike its counterpart there actually IS a plot and a plausible explanation for the events (I'm not saying its the greatest one but then again it's not the crap Activity wants you to believe either)So here it is, apples and oranges meaning both movies have their own ideas however this one is probably a more down to earth lower budget version but its certainly worth a look since most horror aficionados looking for a scare don't really care which actors are in them or the quality of their performance. Though cameras pushed at pivotal moments may be hokey, so are screams from the darkness and bodies flying at the camera.

Title: N/A

reviewText: I myself am a fan of ghost stories and it doesn't usually take a whole lot to keep my attention since I'm often willing to look past the faults of simpler stories. That said, this one has many, many problems.First, not all of the performances are believable. A lot of it is contrived and poorly written and acted. Particularly the mother of the story. The sister is reasonable, and the main role is believable only until the dramatic moments. Then he loses me.Second, so much of the plot is directly lifted from Paranormal Activity. No brownie points for not even trying to make it seem a little different. Many elements are straight from it to the point where you could probably watch the two side by side and they would be nearly identical save for just a few minor elements.Third, the sets are completely disingenuous. It looks like a cheap display home in a cookie cutter neighborhood with a little cheap furniture for staging. It just isn't believable as someone's actual home so it serves as a constant reminder causing the movie to lose some of its realism and voyeuristic quality that the whole home camera thing is supposed to give. It defeats the purpose.Lastly, its completely predictable. Not only because so much of it is lifted from Paranormal Activity, but even the changed/added elements are easy to see coming from a mile away.Basically, if you are fairly easily amused and find it easy to look past some bad movie making and forgive some lack of imagination, you could find worse movies. But you could also find much better. I was reasonably amused, but I'm glad I didn't spend money on it.
summary: Amusing if you like ghost stories, but...

reviewText: Paranormal Entity was a suprise. I did not think it would be as good as it was, while I enjoyed Paranormal Activity, this one creeped me out more. Iam not going to start compering the two films, I will however say they are both very good.It seems quite a few people have a grudge against this film becouse they see it as a copy cat film. But really if that is the case then Paranormal Activity cant be all that original, as Death of a Ghost Hunter was out before both Entity or Activity and both these have a lot in common with that film. Lets be honest we can trace this type of film making( the found footage) all the way back toCannibal Holocaust. So arguing over originality. is as pointless as arguing over, what came first the chicken or the egg.The other argument seems to be that Paranormal Entity is a cheaply made knock off, of Paranormal Activity, well I hate to tell you this folks, but Paranormal Activity didnt look like it cost a bundle to make either. In terms of quality and acting they both looked prety much on par with each other. So all up if you liked Paranormal Activity or any of the other POV type films you should enjoy this one too, unless your the sort of person who likes to argue over ckickens and eggs.

reviewText: As with "Paranormal Activity", the 'Demon' targets a large breasted, young woman, that sulks about in tight fitting tank tops,and displays his affection, by removing the bed-sheets as she sleeps (so much for subtlety)."Paranormal Entity" also shares the aggressive male character, hell-bent on capturing every minute detail on film.A third person is added, in the form of the grieving mother, who'm unwillingly opens a portal, whilst trying to communicate with her deceased husband.There is a Demonologist, though his appearance comes within the final chapter of the film (he's not much help)."Entity" is enjoyable when it veers off the "Paranormal Activity" script.The "footprints" segment is brilliant, as is the "bells", to lesser effect.This one feels a bit more atmospheric & creepy, and the back-story, regarding the dead father, is a nice touch.Unlike "Activity", there is some nudity, which is an added bonus, considering the 'wow' factor of the female lead.All in all, this one succeeds, in all it's low-budget, hand-held glory!

reviewText: Poor Asylum.  The studio is the Search Engine Optimization (SEO) master of the movie industry, making a living out of creating low-budget movies that are reminiscent of bigger franchises in name-only - mockbusters.  So the guys at Asylum must have been gnashing their teeth when Paranormal Activity, an ultra-low-budget horror film, became a runaway smash hit.  Surely, Asylum could make a movie at least as good - after all, it's what they do, right?And so we have Paranormal Entity. You can see that Entity "corrects" all the issues raised about Paranormal Activity: it wasn't violent enough, the attacks happened off screen, and there wasn't enough nudity.  If you felt that way about Paranormal Activity, then Paranormal Entity is for you.The Finley family consists of distraught mother Ellen (Fia Perera), her son Thomas (Shane Van Dyke) and hottie daughter Samantha (Erin Marie Hogan).  With the death of the patriarch David, Ellen is overjoyed when she writes to her deceased husband and gets a response.  That response turns to dread when it becomes clear that it's not the ghost of David but something far more sinister stalking the Finleys.Where Activity preferred to keep the dialogue between its young couple, Entity has three to work with.  Where Activity stays primarily in the house, Activity has its characters do the logical thing and move out - until they realize the entity just follows them. When Activity uses time-lapsed footage to reinforce the creepiness of possession, Entity films it all in real time. When a paranormal expert shows up in Activity but then flees for his life, in Entity he actually sticks around to do combat with the demon. The ending, while predictable, is considerably more graphic but lacks the visceral terror of Activity.Paranormal Entity gleefully embraces its low-budget roots by simply fading to black and jumping to the next plot point.  Depending on your perspective on faux documentaries, this is a lazy way to make a film or a realistic means of propelling the plot. Paranormal Entity will fool precisely no one into thinking that it's real, but then it's unlikely Paranormal Activity fooled anybody either.In short, Paranormal Entity scratches the itch of a lot of folks who were frustrated with Paranormal Activity. Of course, being a mockbuster, it's unlikely any of those viewers saw both movies - you really have to be a fan of one to watch the other.
summary: A curious complement to Paranormal Activity
Title: N/A

reviewText: I did not think I would enjoy this movie, especially knowing it was another companies version of "Paranormal Activity", which was last years "see how much you can make out of promoting the hell out of a low budget film". Activity failed to deliver anything much more then a low budget snore fest with a few sounds thrown in over the top... so, when I heard that it was getting a sequel, surely enough, I had to go and give my peace of mind at the idiots leaving graffiti all over the internet walls with how exciting they think it is going to be. (they really need to see proper horror movies, not what their teeny bopper magazines think is supposedly "cool" till the next issue goes on sale)So while wasting a few minutes of my time abusing those who praised a sequel coming to PA, I noticed there was also mention about this other movie "Paranormal Entity", which a few people where saying was a hell of a lot better then "Activity". I thought I would check it out, just to have an opinion on the debate, and you know, heck, with internet now a days, who needs to pay, so I checked out "Entity" going into it expecting to hate it with a passion, just like I hated "activity"... but now I feel guilty having downloaded it, and I think I will send the company a check for $3 saying it was worth it, or I will wait till the DVD's in the cheapie bin.Well, now I can say, a low budget snore fest's script that gets over-promoted and overrated can be made into a decent movie! The thing that happens in Hollyweed, is that someone writes a script, and it gets passed from studio to studio looking for someone to make it, but along the way, some companies agree to do it, but their needs to be a lot of changes, so the script writers say no, and move onto the next studio... leaving the previous studio thinking, "euhh, who needs your script, we can make our own"... so who knows which was the original script, Entity or Activity, but Entity definitely had better writers an actors behind it... well, the chubby chick in Activity was nice eye candy to me, but I will never give a movie a thumbs up based on how 1 person in the movie looked, as it does not make up for the lack of thought put into the rest of the movie.Still, "Entity" is not something I am praising as a great horror film, i'm just saying it's decent, and a lot better then "Activity".. and this one does lose points from me by trying to CLAIM it's based on a true story... I really wish Hollyweed would stop trying to promote these things as "it really did happen"... as any idiot these days knows when they see "based on a true story" they know what that means is the movie is based on the script, which is now a true story that exists on paper, but still pure fiction, which is why if you try to find any evidence of any of the events in "based on true stories" you will either find you need to allowed access to the film studios script archives, or discover that as much as it is based on an actual true story is that a woman really did visit a supermarket on the 4th of October 1982, only she did not buy eggs, she bought gum, but eggs was much more interesting to the actual films story telling.
Title: N/A

reviewText: There are times where Mockbusters are good, I can't think of one off the top of my head at the moment but trust me there are a few that are so intentionally insane and funny that you just have to love them.  This is not a good Mockbuster and for that I am sad.It's a rip off, pulling from Exorcist, Entity, and of course Paranormal Activity.  It's so very badly done.  The entire film reeks of really bad logic flaws that most Mockbusters manage to avoid in all their low budget glory.  For example: a ghost walks on the ceiling so let's hang bells on wire at foot level because surely that will work.  Wait, it does?The biggest problem with this Mockbuster was that they couldn't use that fishing wire they were employing to actually film the paranormal scenes.  What sort of freaky German ghost cretin closes a closet door before molesting a girl in her sleep?  I mean, why bother?  They aren't going to see your face!  Especially since her brother has no qualms about filming her breasts multiple times, and is far more concerned with holding the camera than helping her; you're a ghost, you aren't even related to her.  Turn on the radio to some Barry White and get jiggy with it Maron!The set was painfully sparse and eye offensive, I mean, pink and green pillows on outdoor furniture serving as living room accoutrements?  How gauche!  Even worse you take the time to clean your ceiling of ghost footprints made by the ashes of your deceased loved one (the father / husband of the family) and yet you don't remove the ink on the glass top coffee table that wipes away clean in one scene and is impervious the next?  Poor form, bad cleaning, tsk tsk.Obviously we never learn why the boy doesn't just call the police since there's a lapse between their deaths and his arrival, or why his sister makes that really bad fake choking noise, or even, well...anything.  I don't want to know where that ghost had his nether regions!There are some amusing Mockbusters out there, but for the most part I was trying to figure out how they couldn't manage to close doors with fishing line or have footprints of different shapes, and how you could (on the door note) even live in a house with nothing being flush and creaking all the time.  This movie hurts the ears, from the bad screams to the bad doors.
Title: N/A

reviewText: On the heels of Paranormal Activity comes Paranormal Entity which does very little to differentiate itself from the well known hit.  It uses the same story idea(save for this entity being horny), the same home video camera, the same time period, and the same format of posting each day.  I loved Paranormal Activity, so I really wanted to like this, but there are more problems than good things about the picture.  The good things are that it follows a successful formula(just not as well) and the daughter's boobs.  They make sure she is in low cut tops and bras the entire film.  That is enough for you to stick around for the boob shots at the end.  The problems are that the activity is just over the top right away.  There is no slow believable build to a climax.  I certainly would not sit back and let a spirit assault me for 16 nights and do nothing but film the insanity.  They try to explain why they couldn't leave or no one would help them, but it just doesn't work.  The story falls apart with the sub par acting and some really low level writing filled with inconsistencies.  A big mistake happens at the beginning and end of the film.SPOILERThe start of the film opens with the son making a 911 call saying his family is dead(mother and sister) Then a message saying the son was arrested for raping and murdering his sister.  He then killed himself in his jail cell.  The end of the movie says that the son and daughter(along with the paranormal guide) were found dead and the mother who was in the hospital took her own life.  It is stupid things like this that make the movie not as fun as it should be.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Paranormal Entity (Shane van Dyke, 2009)The Asylum strikes again. Take a recently-released (and by "recently" I mean "a couple of months ago or less") theatrical flick that made it big, rip it off, slap a very close name on it, and release it direct to video. This is becoming a common-enough occurrence at The Asylum (a company founded by disenfranchised folks who left Village Roadshow Pictures back in the late nineties) that Rolf Potts, writing in The New York Times in 2007, dubbed many of Asylum's releases "mockbusters". Transformers becomes Transmorphers (and the sequel, of course: Transmorphers: Fall of Man), Pirates of the Caribbean becomes Pirates of Treasure Island. Paranormal Activity becomes Paranormal Entity, though in this unsurprisingly crappy ripoff by Shane van Dyke (Transmorphers: Fall of Man, and Dick van Dyke's grandson), he at least added an interesting twist: instead of being a straight rip-off of Paranormal Activity, Paranormal Entity splices the two films referenced in its title, Paranormal Activity and The Entity. And, actually, if you want to take this really, really far, crosses the result with The Poughkeepsie Tapes, John Erick Dowdle (Quarantine)'s second feature. Don't get me wrong, it's still unmitigated crap, but at least it's more amusing to play spot-the-influence here than it is in most Asylum flicks.In case you missed the movies this is ripped off from, a quick synopsis: this is supposed to be actual footage documented by Thomas Finley (van Dyke) at the request of paranormal investigator Edgar Lauren (Inception's Norman Saleet, much better known as a songwriter than an actor) of a haunting. We're told at the beginning of the movie that Thomas Finley has been charged with the murder of Edgar Lauren and the rape and murder of his sister Samantha (Abbey of Thelema's Erin Marie Hogan), so there's no real mystery about who the final girl--umm, boy--is here. Other than Thomas and Samantha's mom Ellen (Shut Up and Kiss Me's Fia Perera), these are the only characters in the film. Aside, of course, from the title creature.Once I realized that there was a strong Entity subtext here (and it took me about five minutes after they mention Thomas is charged with "the rape and murder" of Samantha for that to happen), I had some hopes for the movie's special effects budget. Who that has seen The Entity will ever forget the ghost pawing at Barbara Hershey's [censored for Amazon consumption]? (Not only because it's so prurient, but thirty years ago it was also cutting-edge stuff.) No such luck here, unfortunately; van Dyke is nowhere near as capable a director as Sidney J. Furie, not that that should surprise anyone, and "cutting-edge" is not a term anywhere in his vocabulary. This plays out exactly as you think it will, with a bit of nudity that Paranormal Activity was lacking, but otherwise there's nothing at all original to be found here. Do yourself a favor and ignore its existence. *
summary: Another Asylum mockbuster, what more do you need to know?
Title: N/A

reviewText: I watched this movie by myself before going to bed and Yeah! It creeped me out!What I liked about it was that, unlike the original, you didn't have to sit through BORING countless minutes of getting to know the young couple and their daily routine.The plot is presented, stark and sinister, and within five minutes your already experiencing great fright 'gotcha's in the same great fashion as the original!I loved the slow suspense building and I found the acting, scripting and pacing believable.For those who put this movie down as a cheap homemade clone, I have laugh because Paranormal Activity is shot as a cheap homemade move....So what is your point?If you want your date, honey or wife to be snuggling close to you, rent and watch this little 'gem!'
summary: If You Like The Original..You'll LOVE This!

reviewText: by the commercials they had for it on tv, i was like "SWEET!!!" looked better than 'paranormal activity', so i gave this movie a shot. i ended up fast forwarding through the entire film because it was so boring and lacked substance. you knew the plot already because it had already been done before. 'paranormal entity' didn't provide anything more than 'paranormal activity' did. the plot was worse, there were less graphics, and the movie just plain sucked. i want the last hour of my life back!!!
summary: looked promising, but ended up fast forwarding the entire movie

reviewText: This is an ultra low-budget version of Paranormal Activity...if there could be such a thing (PA cost $15k to make). The premise is very familiar: obsessed filmmaker follows his mother and sister around with camera equipment as he attempts to record the existence of an evil, dangerous force which happens to be plaguing their lives. The entity is particularly fond of the filmmaker's sister, who is often the victim of the attacks.This is a fun, low-budget film in the vein of (say)Night of the Demonswhere the acting is pitiful and the story is full holes...but entertaining nonetheless. I don't think the film is worth the $20 pricetag currently attached to it, but for a lower price one could do a lot worse than spending an evening with the lights turned low and this film in the spinner.

reviewText: A lot of people seem to be hating on this movie. I enjoyed it. I'm interested in watching and hearing story's about spirits. This movie scared the hell out of me when I watched it for the first time. I thought it was a true story. But after the second time watching it I realized it was not real. It is good any way's. I give this movie 5 stars.

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: Okay, we get it. When you see the word "Entity" in the title, a woman gets raped by a ghost (see "The Entity"). Special effects include the TV coming on by itself and a crucifix jumping off the wall. Thomas is filming everything in his house and odd things are happening, although we never know why or what the message "Maron" is supposed to be. The house itself is sparsely furnished, reminding me of a Russian porno set. Samantha, the sister, keeps her diary in the top of her chest of drawers along with one bra top. Who does that? The movie has lengthy scenes of annoying dialouge with long pauses. There was one good tense scene and that was when Thomas was alone by himself in the house. Unfortunately that lasted for only two minutes out of the whole movie.F-bomb and brief nudity. Bad camera angles (noted Samantha's pant's line while she was in the tub.)One scene Samantha is covered with blood, next scene she is cleaned up. WTF can't they get the nude scenes right? The acting is about as well as reality TV. If you hear the sound of a jet flying overhead, it could be an entity. cheap cheap cheapFor a good cheaply made thriller, I would recommend "The Possession of David O'Reilly."
summary: IT'S ASYLUM AND A RIP OFF
Title: N/A

reviewText: A home that houses something more than the occupants understand. That is normally the layout for a haunted affair between four walls and a family, and this movie is no different. The people set up cameras in their home (three, on tripods), utilize a handicam, and resort to other things to see if they can figure out what is trying to take them down. See, something is visiting Sam, the teenage female of the group, and it is becoming more and more violent as this progresses. And, of course, leaving the house is not an option so they do what everyone else does. They call in a person "who knows," and everything gets tangled and terrible.This is a movie that I really could not find redemetion in - and i tried. There were some parts in it that made it look like the movie was going to take off, sure, but these parts were just foreplay for an ending that was terrible. You already knew what was going to happen, too, because the beginning of the movie told you. Yes, it said who was going to die, how it was going to play out, and that these moments were found a year after the event and were published by the family to clear up what had gone on in that house.Aside from a lot of yawning and one - count it, one - moment of creepy footprints, I would say that yawning was the only thing that went on there.I could dog on the movie about quality, the cheap budget, the actors, and the terrible plot for paragraghs on end but I will leave you with this warning instead. Watch the movie, take someone else's advice, and you wil want to write a review like this. you will find yourself murmuring throughout the movie, too, wondering if you should fast-forward or wait until what you know is going to happen. And the part you know is going to happen will come, only it does not give you what it has promised. The doom it says happened IS NOT TAPED - only a fraction of the time is - and that is maddening.I cannot say that this movie was bad enough times to really get across what I'm feeling now. Do not pick this up, please, for the sake of those yet to be born - it might cause a rift in the universe and destroy creation (how's that for a pleading?).
summary: The world is flat, Columbus was a great man, and this movie is fantastic (You guess it - lies come in threes)

reviewText: Ghost tries to rape young woman - how sickening and unoriginal.Samantha usually sleeps in some type of p.j. but the night the ghost is going to attack her, she's in her Victoria Secret undies?  Give me a break.  And listening to Tom's winded breathing all through this movie was annoying. In one scene, she's screaming topless in a bathtub - while wearing jeans? THEN, we finally see the real subject of the movie.........HER BOOBS!  Actually, the movie was MERCILESSLY boring until the end so, I gave it two stars for the end.
